prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] [caption] Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Will:
No, it's okay. This is the real me. When I got the part of the Steel Samurai, with that mask...
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the murder, I arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: Poor old Hammer and the rest had been doing a run-through there since the morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: I, well, I had some errands to run that morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, it was 1:00 when I got to the guard station.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 4
Testimony: I was at the main gate from then until 5:00!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 5
Testimony: Now, the murder happened at 2:30 PM, right?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 6
Testimony: Interesting to me, because a certain man walked right by me at 2:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 7
Testimony: It was Powers! That man right there, and he was heading toward the studio!
Person: Oldbag

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's look through the list carefully.

First, let's go through the testimonies. Testimony 7 says that Powers was seen by Oldbag at 2:00 PM heading toward the studio. So, according to Oldbag, Powers was at the main gate at 2:00 PM.

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 5 is a photo of Powers (?) taken at the gate on October 15 at 2:00 PM. The description says that Steel Samurai is seen walking, dragging one leg. Powers claims that this is actually him because he's playing the Steel Samurai role.

Wait, but if the photo was taken at 2:00 PM, and Oldbag saw Powers at the gate at 2:00 PM heading toward the studio, that seems to align. But wait, the photo shows Steel Samurai walking, which is Powers in character. However, the problem arises if the photo shows Powers in the Steel Samurai costume, but the testimony says Oldbag saw Powers (the real person) at the gate.

Hold on, maybe the contradiction is that the photo shows Steel Samurai, which is Powers in costume, but Oldbag saw Powers (without the costume) at the gate at 2:00 PM. If the photo was taken at 2:00 PM, and Oldbag saw Powers at the same time, then Powers can't be both in the Steel Samurai costume and at the gate as himself. That would mean he was in two places at once, which isn't possible.

Alternatively, maybe the photo shows Steel Samurai, but the testimony says it's Powers. If the photo is of Steel Samurai, then it's actually Powers in costume, but Oldbag saw Powers (the real person) at the gate. So, the photo and testimony both refer to Powers at 2:00 PM, but the photo shows him in the Steel Samurai costume, while Oldbag saw him in his regular clothes. That would mean he was both in costume and not, which is a contradiction.

Wait, but the photo's description says it's "Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg." So, it's Powers in the Steel Samurai costume. The testimony says Oldbag saw Powers (the real person) at 2:00 PM heading toward the studio. So, if the photo was taken at 2:00 PM, and Oldbag saw Powers at the same time, that would mean Powers was both in the Steel Samurai costume (as per the photo) and in regular clothes (as per Oldbag's testimony) at the same time, which is impossible.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 5 (the photo of Steel Samurai at 2:00 PM) and Testimony 7 (Oldbag saw Powers at 2:00 PM). Since Powers can't be both in costume and in regular clothes at the same time, these two pieces contradict each other.
</think>

{"evidence": 5, "testimony": 7}

response:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's see. The characters involved are Maya Fey, Miles Edgeworth, Dick Gumshoe, Will Powers, Security Lady, Jack Hammer, Assistant Penny Nichols, Director Sal Manella, Cody Hackins, and Producer Dee Vasquez. 

The evidence list includes things like the attorney's badge, Powers's letter, a guidemap, Jack's autopsy report, a cardkey, a photo of Powers, the Samurai spear, an empty sleeping pill bottle, a trailer key, Vasquez's memo, a script, Mr. Monkey's head, various trading cards, a "Path to Glory" book, Cody's camera, a steak plate, an old photo of Jack Hammer, and a van. 

The testimonies are from Oldbag, the security lady. She says that the time of Jack's death was 2:30 PM and that the only person she saw go to the studio before then was Will Powers. She also says that no one else went there and that if they had, she would have seen them.

Looking at the evidence, there's a photo of Powers at 2:00 PM, which is before the murder time. Also, there's a mention of Mr. Monkey's head blocking the path between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM. That seems important because if the path was blocked, it might have prevented someone from entering or exiting the studio during that time.

Wait, so if the path was blocked from 2:15 PM onwards, but the murder happened at 2:30 PM, that means the killer would have had to be already inside before 2:15 PM. But according to the security lady, she only saw Powers go in at 2:00 PM, and no one else. However, the photo shows Powers at 2:00 PM, which is before the path was blocked. So, if the path was blocked at 2:15 PM, Powers could have been inside, but what about others? The security lady says no one else went there, but maybe someone was already inside before the path was blocked.

Also, there's a steak plate with sleeping pills and a bone. Maybe someone used sleeping pills to knock out Jack, but that's more about the method of murder rather than the timing. The van is used by Manella to drive Vasquez to Studio One after a meeting in the trailer, which might relate to the timeline but not directly to the contradiction.

So, the key contradiction is between the security lady's testimony that no one else entered the studio before 2:30 PM and the fact that the path was blocked at 2:15 PM, which would prevent anyone else from entering after that time. This suggests that if the killer entered after 2:15 PM, they couldn't have, but the security lady claims only Powers entered at 2:00 PM. However, if the killer was already inside before 2:15 PM, that could mean someone else was there without being seen by the security lady.

Looking at the evidence, the photo of Powers at 2:00 PM (evidence 5) and the testimony from Oldbag that no one else entered (testimony 3) seem to contradict each other because if the path was blocked at 2:15 PM, it's possible that someone else was already inside without being detected by the security lady.

So, the pair that contradicts would be evidence 5 (Powers's photo) and testimony 3 (Oldbag's statement that no one else entered). Or maybe evidence 11 (Mr. Monkey's head blocking the path) and testimony 3. Wait, the blocking of the path at 2:15 PM would mean that anyone entering after that couldn't have been seen by the security lady, but she says she saw Powers at 2:00 PM and no one else. So, if the path was blocked at 2:15 PM, Powers could have been inside, but what about others? Maybe someone was already inside before 2:15 PM and didn't need to go through the blocked path. That would mean the security lady didn't see them, contradicting her testimony that no one else entered.

But the photo of Powers at 2:00 PM is evidence that he was there, and the security lady's testimony that no one else entered. But if the path was blocked at 2:15 PM, it's possible that someone else was already inside before that time, which the security lady didn't account for. So, the contradiction is between the security lady's testimony that no one else entered and the fact that the path was blocked, allowing someone to be inside without being seen.

Therefore, the evidence that the path was blocked (evidence 11) contradicts the testimony that no one else entered (testimony 3). So, the pair is evidence 11 and testimony 3.
</think>

{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 3}
